#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Handle Parenting Criticism
#Text=Often times as parents , we feel as though we are trying our best , and criticism from other parents can trigger a parent to become self-conscious and lower their self-esteem as a parent .
#Text=It can be very tough being a parent in and of itself , however , there is more to parenting than just being a mother or a father .
#Text=Parents often need ways to handle harsh criticism on their parenting skills .
#Text=This article will hopefully help with how to deal with this obstacle in a parent 's life .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Educating Yourself
#Text=Prepare yourself mentally of responsibilities of parents .
#Text=Know that becoming a parent is a big step in one 's life .
#Text=It comes with responsibilities and changes we should become familiar with .
#Text=These changes can begin from the moment a mother is pregnant until the child has grown up .
#Text=Often times we become overwhelmed with the responsibilities .
#Text=Therefore , mental preparation is important
#Text=Research daily parenting skills .
#Text=As parents , we are a significant part of a child 's life .
#Text=It is important that we are aware of the skills we should obtain in order to provide a stable life for our children .
#Text=Apply each skill in your daily life .
#Text=In order to become better at parenting , we need to apply the research we have done to enhance our skills further .
#Text=This step allows us to see the pros and cons and the way children react to certain things we often implement .
#Text=We need to try new things in order to make lasting changes as parents .
#Text=Allow yourself to understand that it is okay not to be perfect .
#Text=Applying skills you have already researched ( mentioned in the previous step ) may not always go as planned .
#Text=Parents and children are similar but they also vary from family to family .
#Text=At times like this , it can become frustrating , so try not to compare yourself to others , because no one is perfect at parenting .
#Text=Being Proactive
#Text=About Criticism
#Text=Ask for advice from other parents .
#Text=Often times those that are experienced parents can offer advice that can help you .
#Text=Every parent tries different methods .
#Text=Therefore , it 's important to try new methods if old ones do not work .
#Text=Listen to other parents that harshly criticize you .
#Text=Sometimes parents are faced with criticism that can be really cruel .
#Text=This can affect parents ' mental strength and self-esteem as parents .
#Text=However , it is important to listen to these criticisms .
#Text=Not to let people walk all over you , but to use the criticism to better yourself as a parent .
#Text=However , it is important that you know yourself as a parent .
#Text=This way you can take out the advice or criticisms that do not pertain to your idealistic parenting skills or who you are .
#Text=Your goal and values are also very important .
#Text=Turn the criticism into advice .
#Text=Even though it might have appeared harsh , remember what your goal is .
#Text=Turning criticism into advice shows a positive attitude and a strong mind .
#Text=Always remember ,
#Text=Do further research and reevaluate .
#Text=This time around , use research you have already done and include the advice and criticism you have received .
#Text=Reevaluate your actions and find ways to make them better .
#Text=Parenting is a process of learning and adapting to change .
#Text=Therefore , reevaluating your actions can result in success .
#Text=Apply what you now know .
#Text=Each skill you have obtained as a parent can now be exercised using different methods when you reevaluated .
#Text=Staying Focused on Your Kids
#Text=Be confident .
#Text=As a parent , it is vital that we show our children we are confident .
#Text=We need to stay motivated and have courage .
#Text=Effectiveness as a parent can be related to self-confidence .
#Text=When you are confident , you can carry out solutions to obstacles as parents .
#Text=Be consistent .
#Text=By this step , you should have a significant change in your attitude .
#Text=You are well aware of the mistakes , and you have corrected them .
#Text=If not , repeat step 8 .
#Text=Implement and exercise the skills you have obtained with your children consistently .
#Text=This can result in adaptability to newer changes .
#Text=Our judgments , when we are introduced to a new obstacle , will become better because of our consistency with other skills we implement .
#Text=This also helps your children understand what role you play and build their trust in whatever you do because it is consistently implemented .
#Text=Be driven by your self-improvement as a parent .
#Text=This allows you to build self-confidence , a stronger mentality , and a positive energy for your children and yourself .
#Text=Watch your offspring grow as you improve as a parent .
#Text=This is a rewarding feeling as you grow closer to your children .
